div1.head: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Henry Rose Carter, November 5, 1915
div1.opener:
PM
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
November 5, 1915.
The Medical Officer in Charge,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
Referring to your letter of the 27th ultimo, you are
informed that voucher should be submitted in favor of
Attendant G. C. Duke as reimbursement for funds paid for his
care and treatment in hospital at Columbia, S. C., in
amounts of $3.00 and $6.00 for hospital care and profes-
sional treatment, respectively. Paragraph 453, Regulations
of the Service should be cited on voucher as authority for
said expenditures.

A copy of your letter of the 27th ultimo, and receipts
for each of the above charges should be attached to bill,
which should be prepared on form 1949. The charges should
be itemized and dates given.
By direction of the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, W g Stimpson
Assistant Surgeon General. Incl: 1.
